The '''Slag-hills''',<ref name=Hills>{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019, March 25, p. 1094</ref> also called the '''slag-mounds'''<ref name=Mounds>{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019, March 4, p. 1093</ref> and the '''slag-heaps of Mordor''',<ref>{{L|64}}</ref> were endless rows of high mounds of debris, composed of crushed and powdered rock and fire-blasted and poison-stained earth,<ref name=Marshes>{{TT|Marshes}}, p. 631</ref> that had been piled over many years by toiling [[Orcs]] in the [[Desolation of the Morannon]] in front of the [[Black Gate]] of [[Mordor]].<ref name=Opens>{{RK|Gate}}, p. 887</ref>

==History==
===Disaster of the Morannon===
In {{TA|1944}}, King [[Ondoher]] of [[Gondor]] positioned himself with his Guard and banner on a low natural hill when the main force of his army, which had just travelled north from [[Ithilien]], was suddenly [[Disaster of the Morannon|attacked]]. War-chariots of the [[Wainriders]] and an unexpectedly large force of cavalry from the east had approached on a road that went eastward from north of the Black Gate to a point north of the [[Ered Lithui]] and north of [[Barad-dûr]]. King Ondoher and his son [[Artamir]], and almost all of his Guard, were killed in battle.<ref>{{UT|Northmen}}, thirteenth paragraph</ref><ref name=Note>{{UT|8e}}, note 16</ref>

During unknown later years Orcs piled up blasted stone and earth on the hill on which King Ondoher had died.<ref name=Note/>

===Frodo approaches the Desolation of the Morannon===
[[File:The Lord of the Rings - The Two Towers - Slag Mounds.jpg|thumb|250px|The Slag Mounds in ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers]]'']]
On [[4 March]] {{TA|3019}},<ref name=Mounds/> [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]], [[Samwise Gamgee|Sam]], and [[Gollum]] came to the Slag-hills and hid in a hollow.<ref name=Marshes/> The next day Frodo prepared to enter [[Mordor]] by the Black Gate but was persuaded by Gollum to head south to seek a more [[Cirith Ungol|secret way]] through the mountains.<ref>{{TT|Gate}}, p. 639-47</ref>

===Battle of the Morannon===
Approaching the Black Gate on [[25 March]] {{TA|3019|n}},<ref name=Hills/> [[Aragorn]] arrayed his meager forces on two of the Slag-hills behind a "moat" of reeking mud and foul-smelling pools. It was upon these low hills that the [[Army of the West]] was surrounded and attacked by the forces of [[Sauron]] in the [[Battle of the Morannon]], and it was here that they witnessed the downfall of Sauron when Frodo completed his [[Quest of the Ring|quest]].<ref name=Opens/> It was assumed by historians that King Aragorn placed his troops on the same hill on which King Ondoher had made his stand 1,075 years before.<ref name=Note/>
